The wife and I ordered the gumbo and halibut. My gumbo was great. The seasoning they used with the rice etc. was fantastico. My wife's Halibut was so great it melted in her mouth.   The South Point hit a home run with their oyster bar and if you don't mind the old world casino smell go for it. If you happen to hit the place during the last weeks of October be ware because the Rodeo is in town and it tends to smell like somebodies ranch.

Been here a few times and this place is the Bomb, I've tried just about everything on the menu and everything has been super tasty. The only down fault is this place gets super packed and it's a very small area, there's a bar that's not to big and a few tables. When it's busy you'll be waiting a long time to get seated, but it's worth it...

Meh, I've experienced way better. We sat at the bar and ordered Manhattan Clam Chowder and Fried Shrimp and Scallops. Clam chowder tasted pretty good, hence the two stars. I wonder if it's fresh. But because nothing else was fresh - i doubt it. At least it didn't taste like it was from a can.  The scallops were extremely mushy, to the point of disgust. We told the waiter, then one of the cooks, nothing was done. All the cook said was that they try not to overcook the scallops. Makes sense, but c'mon at least cook them. We barely ate anything off our plate.   Unfortunately for them (and the diners), everything appeared to be made from being frozen. Everything looked that way. I was hoping for something fresh. I guess my hopes were too high for a casino restaurant.   We noticed that they shake all fries and fish in the same bowl for seasoning. So, because of  that the fries taste like fish. I guess that's okay if you are eating fish&chips, but not for the homie next to us who hates fish and ordered a chicken sandwich. Fries were mediocre and over seasoned, by the way.   Upon looking at the menu, we thought it would be a really good choice...sorely disappointed. I will not come back here.

1 star = for the awesome & flavorful clam chowder; one of the best I've ever tasted  2 stars = for the fried calamari.  Great and generous portion!  Every bite was crisp.  I don't like the sauce though.  3 stars = oysters!  We always get a dozen...they're fresh and yummers!  4 stars = the way they cook in front of you...check it out for yourself!  Go try it now if you are craving oysters.  They usually have crab leg specials too!  South Point is an awesome casino too!  Huge place and lots of video poker!

Well, me and hubs were pleasantly surprised.  Needed something quick and hearty at 10 pm in the South Point.  We opted for the counter at the oyster bar.    After great debate.....gumbo? linguine and clams? We landed on calamari and clam chowder.    My New England clam chowder was filling, creamy, buttery and well seasoned.  My husband was less impressed with his Manhattan clam chowder but said it was good.  The calamari was flavorful and cooked near perfection - just slightly over.    The service was very nice, friendly and efficient.  We were full and happy within 20 - 25 minutes.    The prices are a bit high.  Chowders are $8 per bowl and calamari was $12.  Entrees range from $19 - $27 for gumbo, pasta, fra diavlo and such.    All in all, a very nice dinind expereince.  Little to nothing to complain about.  Warm chewy rolls with soft butter served too! A definite plus!  We would go back.

Date of Visit: 1/15/11  Reason: to treat my brother from Hawaii for some oysters that he'd been craving all day.  What did "we" have?  1. 2 dozen half shell oysters:  they were fresh and were all opened in front of us.  Not sure what type of oysters they were, but they were the appetizer size oysters.  They were bigger than normal, which is a plus.  2. 1 dozen clams: again, not sure what type of clams they were, but they were smaller than I thought they would be.  The good thing about them is that they were very tasty.  Just give it a little dab of tabasco but no lemon and you're good to go.    3. 1 1/2 lb. of Snow Crab legs:  this is the dish that eventually didn't make this review a 5 star review.  Why? Because the legs are previously frozen and already cooked, BUT the way they reheat them was dumping them into boiling water.  This causes the flavors to go away because it was being soaked in the water.  If they were to steam them, it would've been much better.  Good enough for us because we were craving these dishes all day!  Hope this helps and Enjoy!!!

Located in the South Point Hotel. Worth stopping by. Oysters are meaty and delicious. Clam chowder was creamy and on point. Service is outstanding. Ambience is nothing to brag about but otherwise, this place delivered.

Made a quick stop in for a bowl of clam chowder, it was edible but nothing id write home about. Home is Monterey, CA so clam chowder is tough anywhere else. Was sat fast at the bar, the service wasnt bad and the food was served pretty quick too. $8 bowl of clam chowder, sure why not if your really craving it. But wouldnt make a special trip as i felt like it was just a bite to eat and nothing memorable.
I loved this restaurant t, They have probably the best New England Clam Chowder ever. It's inside the Southpoint casino.
The food is excellent but the wait can be long. Get one of the pan roasts, you won't be disappointed.

I was impressed for a oyster bar at South Point.  Came here to eat a quick snack before a movie. Had clam chowder and some oysters. Both dishes were good and fresh.   Service was also quick and friendly.
Seafood delicious, clam chowder, delicious best seafood restaurant in vegas...............
get the panroast- combination of crab and shrimp in a buttery creamy tomato sauce...its yum!

I tried the SalmonClub Sandwich....Ummm it wasn't what I expected - When I think of a club sandwich I imagine something built like a BLT. Thin layers of stuff but no this was a big sandwich with a thick piece of Salmon and Smoked Salmon. I love smoked Salmon so enjoying that was a given but everything else in the Sandwich just didn't work for me. Too much was going on.... My Mom really enjoyed her Shrimp Scampi but had to add salt for taste (I hate paying for something when I have to season it myself) My Dad just had the Clam chowder which looked really good. I may just stick to that on the next visit. I would like to try the Lobster grilled cheese as well.... Service was good and speedy, ya I'll be back to try other dishes!!

Happy Hour prices are unbeatable, $11 for half oysters & half clams, sign me up! Seafood is fresh and delicious. I saw a guy next to me order the shrimp cocktail, dang the shrimps are HUGE! I will surely get that on my next trip. Service is always good, the waiter had a big smile on his face the whole entire time, very inviting atmosphere.

I came to this place with high hopes. The wait at the Oyster Bar in the Palace Station was much  too long, so we looked for an alternative. Sure, there was no wait here, but there still was a decent crowd dining at this joint. Here's what we got:   [Apps] Louisiana Oysters: not that impressed with their oysters. I've definitely have had fresher tasting stuff. I didn't think these were worth ordering. Calamari: Great app, but that was expected with something fried. Oyster Rockafeller: These were pretty much the same oysters as before, but masked wit a buttery spinach spread. I felt like I was eating spinach dip on a shell. Couldn't even taste the oyster. Bloody Mary Oyster Shooters: Nothing impressive  For the entre, I ordered the Lobster Grilled Cheese. It was an ok dish, but overly slathered with butter. It probably would have been a little better  with more cheese melted into it. Lots of lobster meat in this sandwich though, which was very good. The homemade chips that it came with had a nice crisp to it, but it had a tad bit too much salt  All in all, it was a pretty mediocre meal. I can't see myself coming back here. There are far better alternatives in Vegas. Initially, we came here just to down some fresh oysters, but that ended up being the worst part of the meal.

I've been to about four other oyster bars in town (station, palace, orleans, suncoast) and this one is pretty good. It's the same size and set up as the suncoast one- an oval bar with the cooks in the middle with a few tables around.   I had the gumbo @ $17.00 (wild rice, shrimp, sausage, chicken, okra), which was pretty good but not as good as palace or station's (but better than cheesecake factory). The flavor was really good and had thick sauce (traditional). It has less seafood than the palace/station version which explains the lower price. The shrimp and chicken were pretty good size, though. The hard rolls were very good. I like that there is a cracker basket with a variety of crackers, ritz, saltines, including oyster crackers (love it).     It wasn't spicy (like a little heat) but Cookie (our server) gave us Cholula. She was really good- refilled his drink without my husband asking. She was very friendly, always had a smile on her face and would check on us periodically.  My husband got the crab and shrimp pan roast and enjoyed it (but his favorite is still palace). There were a couple crab shells that he would of preferred to not have.   The bill for both of us was $38, which was pretty good.  After reading the other reviews, I am curious to try the linguine with clams and the fish and chips next time. The special was 1 1/2 pounds of crab legs for $16.95- a lot of people ordered that.

Oysters aren't my thing. They never have been, and yes I have tried them multiple times. I can't get over the consistency. So this probably isn't a fair review since oysters are their main thing. My dad likes them, but he's not the one writing this review.   As for the other items on the menu. They are just ok. Probably something you can get anywhere. Nothing stands out or is super amazing.   Salmon Cesar salad: the salmon was really fishy. Waaaay too much dressing on the lettuce.   Linguini with clams in red sauce: if you look at my picture, everything is pretty much swimming in the sauce. This was pretty much a soup with noodles and clams. The sauce was a little on the bland side. I had to put some Tabasco sauce to give it some kick. The noodles and clams were good though.   New England clam chowder: thick and rich. Lots of potatoes and big pieces of clam mixed in. I would order this again.   The service is excellent. My water glass is always full. Bread basket is never empty. Staff is smiling.   I'll probably be back, but not because I picked it.

This was my first time eating at Big Sur  I was very disappointed.  The food was not good  the portions were ok.  The staff had a give a F*/%k attitude.  If you want a great oyster bar. Go to Stations Properties. Especially Palace Station Oyster Bar. Maybe the chef and staff from Big Sur Oyster Bar should to Station Casinos oyster bar to get so training.

Wife and I each had same of lunch portion shrimp jambolaya. Was quite good. I added crush red pepper, ground black pepper, parmesan, and a bit of salt. We also split a side of fresh made potato chips. They needed salt which we added. Very good also. Thanks folks. Fairly quick service here and just right everything.

Good place to go for some seafood cravings especially while wandering around the South Point casino. The crab cocktail is tasty and the lobster grilled cheese and other sandwiches are good. I'm not a big fan of the Cajun or Creole dishes because they are not really accurate therefore I don't find them worth the price.   If you are looking for a light lunch this is a good place if you want a really good seafood dinner or creole Cajun food I do not recommend it.

Decent food, horrible service. Three of us went. We all got our food at different times. My aunt was done eating before I was served. And I was halfway done before they brought mom's out. Had to ask to get refills on water until we were leaving and once the waiter dropped off the check he disappeared.  So unless you are going to the movies or bowling there just don't eat there. Even then, you might try the deli. So different than Primarily Prime Rib.

I came here for their happy hour half off oysters. Their oysters are very delicious and big. I love oysters so this place didn't disappoint on the oysters. I ordered the deep fried shrimp and scallops From the lunch menu. It was tasty but portion was pretty small. It was more like an appetizer instead of lunch. I would recommend to come here for the oysters for sure. I haven't tried the other stuff on the menu but they looked pretty decent.

MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT! I don't know maybe I'm trippin. You guys know I just got back from New Orleans right??? So I ordered gumbo for $20!!! Why did it taste like it was from a can! The okra was hard, not cooked all the way and the sausage was extremely rubbery. Well you can see for yourself with my pics. So thennnn, I return it because I literally CANT eat it. So then they return with (drumroll please) some #PinkOysters!!! If you don't believe me look at my pictures. I think the oysters were diabetic or something. Maybe it was that time of the month. Oh, did I mention the oysters were $16 for 1/2 dozen??? Yuuup! The customer service was good and we sat next to some cool people...THANK GOD!  Enter this place at your own risk.

The food is average.  The oysters are the most bland I've ever tried.  The shrimp cocktail and crab cocktail are very good.  The salads are not worth it at all. All fairly basic for the price.  If you eat here go for the hot dishes and stay away from the salads and sandwiches.   The cooks and waitstaff are friendly. The hostess is not. Sometimes they throw the food at you pretty quickly.

Oysters!  Hey I love them. I am down with "half shell". When dealing in the raw, one must demand fresh. Fresh is what I get here. I had fantastic service. Prices aren't over the top. For oysters in the raw, I go here for decadent arrays of those little mushy creatures I love so dearly.

Had the Crab cakes and they were great. Hubby had the linguini and clam with white sauce which was buttery, creamy, and fair amount of clam.  Alfredo was our waiter and we loved how attentive he was to our needs. Coming back as often as we can.

This used to be one one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. I looked forward to eating here for a year and was greatly disappointed. The lobster grilled cheese used to be the best sandwich I had ever had but it has changed and not for the better. It is lacking in cheese content, it is supposed a cheese sandwich after all. The clam chowder is still decent but my Bowl was a bit gritty. The fish and chips my brother ordered was amazing so that is what gets the two stars. Overall a highly disappointing experience

Went for lunch on a Friday. Don't miss the lunch specials on the board. Server Alfredo was like a extremely friendly street ninja. Back and forth taking care of me as needed. Always knowing what I needed before I did, taking care of me and silently moving on to the next guest. Ordered a dozen to start. The chefs hands were a blur as he popped them quicker than my eyes could follow and had them  sitting in front of me almost immediately.  Well done gentlemen.
Good food and good service. The clam chowder was good. Fish slider with homemade chips and fried calamari were good as well. We received good service from the hostess and servers behind the bar.

One night for dinner, my bf's mom took us out to eat here.  The food was not bad, but nothing to really rave about. I had a New England Clam Chowder, which just tasted like soup I could make out of a can. However, my bf's mom had a linguine pasta with oysters that looked really good. This place wasn't great, but it didn't suck either.  + pros: + seafood was fresh, which was surprising since we were in the middle of the desert.   - cons: - there was a fly in my water. i don't know how the waiter didn't notice it when he poured my water. - restaurant is situated right in the middle of a casino.. not like most casino restaurants where they're usually enclosed so you aren't bothered with the chaos going on. but this restaurant was literally placed in the middle of the casino, and you're pretty much eating right next to all the slot machines and a huge walkway. sucks because when i was trying to eat, there were people smoking in the casino almost right next to us... not so pleasant.

So I'm reviewing the raw oysters mostly with some consideration for the place as a whole.  I came here after searching the web for good oyster deals in Las Vegas.  It's not the greatest place and separate from all other casinos.  So I was hoping for the best.  Alas, it was not to be.  I walked up to a mostly empty restaurant on an early Monday evening and was seated right up front in the bar.  I asked the guy behind the counter if they had an oyster that was large and briny as I like a strong salty, seafood-like flavor.  He showed me what they had and they were sizeable sure enough.  And even though I missed Happy Hour (before 4PM), I ordered a dozen anyways.  A dozen for $27.  Not outrageous but not a happy hour price either.  My spidey sense was tingling because they had that kinda orangy clam like color to them.  They also looked a bit dense much like clams do too.  But still, I was hoping for the best.  Unfortunately, they were completely tasteless.  They were called Louisiana Gold Seal Oysters.  I had to dump a bunch of seafood sauce on each one just to taste something other than a cold lump of goo in my mouth.  I know most people don't like briny, salty oysters.  But that's my thing and a reason some gals like me.  At least they were fresh and very cold (well stored).  A customer sitting next to me asked how I like them and I told him the truth.  He said he was having the chowder and said it was good.  I peered down the counter and saw a couple eating.  The lady had the Alaskan crab legs and unless they were dry, it's hard to go wrong there since they are shipped pre-cooked and frozen from Alaska.  They looked ok.  That's why you should buy Alaskan crab from Costco and not a 5* dining establishment.  The waiter asked how I liked them.  I told him the truth.  He made a sad frown but did not offer to get a manager or make any kind of amends.  I asked him if I could've ordered one or three instead of the dozen and he said yes.  I asked how much each would be if I ordered one or three and he said $3 each.  I was yelled, "THREE DOLLARS FOR THESE?"  Realizing how loud I was, I chilled out, paid the bill and left.  If you like salty, briny oysters, this is NOT your place to go to.  I go all around Vegas looking for the best oyster deal and for what I'm looking for, this is NOT it.    This place is getting two stars only because the guy next to me looked happy with his chowder and the place was clean and quick (I've been to empty places that took forever, god knows why).  My normal go to is the new-ish oyster bar in the Hard Rock.  I've never seen it have a line.  They usually have at least 4 different types of orders.  They are open to 2A on Friday and Saturday (to 12A all other days).  They don't have a happy hour.  But so far this is the place to beat.  That Palace Station line is long but after this, I may have to wait in it just to try it.

The food here is bland and sucks.  Just go to the Oyster Bar at Palace Station.  I hate Station Casinos, they blow, but the Oyster Bar is awesome.  The Manhattan chowder at Big Sur:  Campbell's tomato soup with canned potatoes and clam juice.  Oysters Rockefeller:  Bland.  Small oysters, taste of parmesan and cream and nothing.  No flavor layers. No salt.    Pan Roast:  more tomato soup, with unflavored unseasoned shrimp and lobster.  Not even hot sauce made this better.  Sad.  The bread, beer, and service were okay.  I will never eat here again.  It should be closed.  Too expensive for crap food.

I read some positive reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a go.  I went on a Thursday evening and the bar wasn't crowded.  I was seated quickly by a friendly young man.  It took quite awhile for the server to come.  I was surprised how he didn't couldn't answer simple questions such as what the contents of the Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter were or what vodka was used.  This place has a very small menu, so I would expect my server to be knowledgeable.  I ordered oysters on the half shell.  They didn't seem super fresh but definitely weren't spoiled.  I like crackers with mine but their cracker baskets were so crammed full, finding an unbroken packet was like getting a $10k pay out playing single bets on the penny slots.  The Tabasco was old and crusted and the cocktail sauce tasted cheap.  My server was polite but never asked how things were, if I needed anything, and he was slow to refill my beverage.  It really felt like the bare minimum service.   I had a far better experience at the Gold Coast oyster bar my fella took me to but its just too far to be my regular place. (Oysters fresh shucked, bigger, prices better.)  This place wasn't awful, just not what the yelp reviews led ms to believe.  I am planning on trying Big Al's next week. Hope its better than this experience.

Ok SouthPoint, you really need to name this salad after me. I've been ordering and coming to this restaurant for at least 5 years and still it hasn't made it to the menu. I get people asking me what I order as its soooo yummy looking. It's a Caesar Salad (tossed and mixed with the dressing) with the lump crab from the appetizer but I have it grilled. Every server including Manny who knows it best knows to put it up as soon as he sees me sitting down at the counter. It's quite pricey but worth it ($20). Use your SouthPoint points from the reward card to help finance it.

So the cook Jose was super nice and helpful. Our server Lorena was nice too but the place was so filthy! We sat at the bar and instead of cleaning any of the 20+ seats, they chose to jam us between two parties (who did promptly get up, but then they left the seats uncleared with dirty dishes and half eaten food for the entirety of our meal) which was super uncomfortable and left the rest of the experience tainted with other people's leftovers and dirty dishes.   We didn't have super high expectations going into an oyster bar at the south point, but we did expect it to be clean. Instead of having employees standing around talking story and letting one busser do the whole room himself, encourage everyone to help and pitch in. That's just me, but hey, what do I know. Lol

I have to admit, I don't like to come here often, because a shorty (literally) like me hates eating at a bar where everyone can see you dining from across the way (and the casino for that matter).  It is located right next to the cashier's cage and many many slot machines.  If you can get past that, this Oyster Bar Does have some delicious eats.   I have tried their Oysters, Crab Legs, Manhattan clam chowder, Lobster Grilled Cheese and their Cioppino.  Omg Cioppino is to die for, but let me get back to that.    Oysters, can't pass it up, you're at an Oyster bar.  They crack it fresh right in fornt of you.  Honestly, for crab legs, you are better off going to a buffet.  Manhattan clam chowder and their New England Clam chowder are delicious.  Reminds me of Bay Area when you go to eat the Clam Chowder bowls, but thier chowder is chunkier!    I love their Lobster Grilled Cheese, I think its very expensive though, but then again it is Lobster.  I remember it used to be about $18, I think, but when I went there this past weekend to fulfull my craving the price was right around the $30 mark, think I'll have to pass this time.    So on to the Cioppino.  I must have missed this, or it could be a new menu, but I could see that everyone was dining on some monstrous bowls.  We took my friend here and as he ate the Cioppino he kept saying "Mmmm, OMG, Wow, Oooh, this is great..." LOL, so we had to come back to try it ourselves.    Um, yes, we were spewing those same words.  Its a $31 bowl of goodness, big portions for two, maybe even three to share.  Mussels, Calamari, HUGE Scallops, shrimp, and lobster sitting on a bed of linguini in this delicious tomato based sauce.  Seriously, I'm not often a pasta eater, but today, man was I glad I agreed to have pasta that day.  We shared the bowl and still had leftovers.  I'm telling you, its that good.    Pricey, yes, but a must try YES!

I am a local in Henderson   I love this oyster bar.  Whenever I go to South Point I come to the oyster bar and find Claudia!!!  She is so friendly and helpful. Always recommends something good. The food was great, but the service was the Best!

Second time now i had a whole plate of oysters rockefella! I could of ate two maybe even 3. service ain't that bad and the pai gow table is just 50 steps away. never really tried anything else! but the oysters are great!   I don't like bloody mary drinks but i had to try the bloody mary oyster shooter, i don't like it but i still ate the oyster.

Wow. This place really knows how to do New England clam chowder right.  First impression when you see the thickness of it's consitancy is "this can't be good" but it will taste will blow you away.  I want the receipe.

This was my fifth or sixth time here and to be honest it was hit or miss.  But today everything was spectacular.  It is honestly the first time I haven't seen a line or had to wait. One thing thats for sure is that the service is always great.  Our server was fast to greet us,  very friendly,  and very efficient.  My girlfriend and I shared a bowl of new England chowder and it was bomb diggity! Not too salty,  plenty of ths, and the texture was absolutely perfect.  My girlfriend had the steamed clams and I was really jealous because that white wine and garlic sauce is a 10 out of 10. I went for the pound and a half of King crab legs and it was good.  Not the best but not bad.  Steamed crab is Steamed crab right?  I will definitely be back and definitely point other r people in this direction.  5 stars!
Salmon melt was horrible. Inedible. Oysters were pretty good. Tilapia was ok. Will not be back.
Five stars for the clam chowder! Pass on the oysters Rockefeller! They lost a star because they were subpar. I've had waaaay better but I don't think I've had worse!

This oyster bar offers $7.95 luncheon specials Monday - Thursday from opening until 4PM.  My wife chose shrimp jambalaya while pasta primavera with shrimp was my dining destination.  Each of the dishes were very fresh tasting and a return engagement is promised.

Second time here better than the first.  Last time I had the oysters on the half shell which tasted old.  Boy was I disappointed.  This time I avoided the raw stuff and went for the Gumbo.  After I added a lot of Tabasco and Cholula I got it tasting pretty good.  My wife had the king crab special which she has liked both times.   For Las Vegas it is an ok bet for a decent price.  I just hope she doesn't make me come back next time we pass this way.

Have the Rockefeller Oysters. They are excellent! Everything on the menu is really really good!! Service is OK, drinks take a minute to get because your waitress has to go get from the closest bar in the casino.   Decent pricing and easy to find in the casino, it's right next to the gross buffet.  For the record, I know Buffet's are huge with tourist but they almost always suck! Except for the Bellagio's. I would much rather have one good meal instead of heat lamped under/over cooked stale food.  Anyway, if you like mussel's and clams this place is a must.

This place was okay. Average food for a really expensive price. We got half a dozen oysters, which did taste fresh though, and decent sized. We also got the linguini and clams in white wine! Very good, the sauce is super creamy & there's a lot of clams! I do recommend it. If you're looking for a small bite, do stop by, but if you're hungry, go to the buffet in Southpoint instead of this place.

This was my first time at South Point and I happily tried a few of their restaurants! The Big Sur Oyster Bar was Awesome!! I had a cup of New England Clam Chowder that was absolutely fantastic (I'm picky about my chowder!!) for only $5.00! For my dinner I had the Fish Sliders for $16 that were very tasty, the tarter sauce is some of the best Ive had, I had to order extra as I like a "wetter" fish sandwich. The portions were good and I was stuffed. Elisabeth was my waitress and she was great, I felt bad though as there were 2 Floridian ladies next to me and the one had ordered the shrimp scampi from the menu and then kept insisting it wasn't what she wanted, think they brought it out about 3 times, it looked delicious to me! Elizabeth handled it well and had the chef come over and then Patricia the manager came over too until the lady was satisfied, i was myself mystified, you order the same menu item 3 times and its not what you want?? was impressed with the service and the food. I will be back next year and will be eating here again and again!

After venturing around the misty lands of Las Vegas casinos for countless hours and spending money for a chances to hit the big jack pot...I was suddenly craving oysters and looked from afar this oyster bar!   My siblings and I decided to give it a try and see if oysters at an oyster bar are any better the any regular restaurant that would serve oysters.   In result, it wasn't all that great. The oysters were actually the same as any other place. The taste, presentation, and smell was all the same. Honestly there was no difference. However it is in a casino so for convenient purposes and if one wanted to have oysters and a drink in between their gambling session, it isn't too bad.

This place gets me right in the feels. Finding it was a pure happy accident as who would think that a tiny counter restaurant in the middle of a smoke-filled casino floor, in the middle of a desert, would house some of the best seafood that Las Vegas has to offer? I've eaten seafood up and down the East Coast, but this place is my favorite. I've been here about half a dozen times and have never been disappointed. The service is always friendly, the oysters fresh, the prawns are ginormous, and the mussels in white wine sauce bring a tear to my eye.  I've met locals who eat here regularly. That's the true sign of a great restaurant.

The happy hour for oysters and clams is Great! I was expecting a little bit more food then what we received,but all in all it was tasty. The popcorn shrimp was crispy and not dry like you get in most places. We will be returning again soon.

Took my brother and GF for quick appetizers...1:40 pm or so....one thing stand out and it was the service 100% on it, from hostess to server. Had raw oyster from LA, fresh and good. Oyster rockefeller, same type of oyster and they did a good job. Finally had the seafood ceviche, not bad but ok. Would I come back? Yes, would like to try other dishes.

This is my least favorite oyster bar, but I'm a seafood fanatic and I'm often at the South Point so I keep giving this place a chance. Time after time I am let down. This last experience I have had enough.  Our server Emmanuel (I believe that's his name), is the worse server ever. Our first experience with him, he gets our order wrong because he doesn't bother to write it down. When our food came out, the chef had to take it back and remake it. We are by far not difficult customers but I am clear on what I want, like for instance, rice instead of pasta? Come on.  This last time, my boyfriend and I decided on a bowl of clam chowder and the catch of the day. Our soup never came out. When our entree came out, I told the chef to cancel the soup. He confronted the server about not bringing out our soup and we hear the entire conversation. Instead of the server taking responsibility for the soup, he says, they didn't tell me. As a server, a soup is a starter. In this case, we only ordered one entree, but if he was confused, he should have asked if we wanted the soup first or at the same time. The soup is ready to scoop at any time. How can the entree be brought out first? After that, he never came to check on us. He took his mistake out on us. Like I said, this is not our first encounter with him. He saw we finished our meal and didn't say anything to us, just printed the receipt and placed it in front of us. I did not want to deal with him anymore so brought the receipt to the hostess and paid there. First time ever I did not tip in a restaurant. As many times as I have had bad service, I still felt bad and still left a little, but in this case, he was so rude and did not care so neither did I.  We were so unsatisfied with our service and meal that we went upstairs to the bowling area and got two hot dogs and a pretzel to eat while playing bingo.  The catch of the day was the orange roughy and it really lacked in salt. I tasted nothing from the fish or the sauce on it. I didn't know if it was just me so I asked my boyfriend and he said he didn't taste anything as well, just felt the warmth of the food.  Ughh, I'm frustrated because I want to like this place but I just can't. I probably will never be back after this experience. I hope the South Point does something about the service here.

Simply awful!  If you want a raw bar, this IS NOT the place. The only oysters they had were from Louisiana, HUGE, and just wrong!  The clams were middlenecks chewy and bitter!  The only good thing was the hot horseradish.

Best clam chowder on the strip! We love this place. My husband always gets oysters and I always get clam chowder and a salad at least. Everything we have had has been excellent and have never been disappointed!

The quality of food has gone WAY down.  The calamari was pretty much just small fried batter pieces. I'm pretty sure the Cesar salad lettuce was just packaged lettuce because the color was dull greenish-yellow and just thrown into a pile on a plate. We also ordered the shrimp scampi, which was overall very average. The shrimp pieces however were large and pretty good.   But for the prices they charged, the food was bad. I get that the restaurant is in a hotel/casino, but it's not even a real restaurant considering the location and lack of walls.

I've been here a few times and while the salad I always order here is always solid it isn't my number one choice Oyster Bar to go to. The ceaser salad wouldn't stand alone it's the Ahi Tuna that makes it so good. I order it blackened medium rare and it's always fresh. The ciopinno here doesn't compare to Stations ciopinno. Not even close. It's $35 here and that's $15 more than Stations and they give more fish in theirs. It's not the price that's the factor it's the taste and amount of fish that make Stations the winning ciopinno. It's more expensive here because they serve lobster in theirs. The service here was good and is an ok choice but I'll stick to Stations from now on. Solid and delicious.
1 pound of peal and eat shrimp and pan roast add the lobster with pasta is what we had. It's was AWESOME! Super fresh and delicious. This place will not disappoint you.

went twice during our stay at SOUTH POINT -- dinner thursday evening and lunch saturday.   food was pretty good both times. we had:   loved watching my FRIES getting tossed in a big bowl while they got seasoned.   the CALAMARI (cocktail sauce with extra horseradish instead of the marinara) -- could have crisped a little longer in the fryer but still awfully good.   a dozen OYSTERS (actually a couple dozen oysters since we had them both times) -- they were a little dry and i had to work a little since they did not sever the abductor muscle. but i love those juicy, little nuggets so still worth the effort.   CLAM CHOWDER (like there's a style besides new england -- what is that red stuff anyway ??) -- i managed a tasty spoonful or two before the kids loaded up their bowls with oyster crackers.   steamers -- clams, white wine, garlic and a little bread to sop up the juice -- there's nothing wrong with that.   the nice thing about an open kitchen is you get fed and a floor show. the bad thing about an open kitchen is sometimes the floor show detracts from the experience. at lunch, everybody seemed animated and happy to be there. at dinner the droll little trolls behind the counter clearly wanted desperately to be somewhere else.   if they were my crew, i would oblige them.
Definitely the best deal in town. They give pretty good size servings and fairly cheap. Everything on the menu is recomended.

I've been to this small restaurant several times, while visiting Vegas. This place has really good seafood, which is cooked in the center of the restaurant....for all to see. This place is always 75% full. The staff is great,  the restaurant is clean and the service is great. Love coming here. The food is a little pricey, but worth it
Good was so so and over priced. Service was pretty good though.this Filipino water waited on us and was very nice. Forgot his name though. I don't think I'll be back.

I've been to Seattle, SF, and other famous places for Oysters. For this place to be in Vegas and with my low expectancy on quality food away from the ocean... I was very impressed. A dozen will run you $24 but well worth it. Other dishes included was Lugini and clams which i saw prepared within visual range. Ocean like bar theme but not too much interaction with the staff. Would have liked to see more atmosphere but the food made up the difference. Great job.

Stay away and do yourself a favor. Greasy food, served cold. Very little flavor and for some reason too expensive. We ordered the scallops- creepy oil puddled in the bottom of the plate, breading fell off to reveal a tasteless little scallop. Gumbo is cheap soup, no roux, no coloring. No good. Just the wrong thing at the wrong place.  Paid north of $60 for the worst meal of the week.

I had the crab legs, and New England clam chowder. My girl had the clams on a half shell, New England clam chowder, and shrimp scampi.   Needless to say we are not happy with this food. I have made clam chowder, and I have also made crab legs that have had more flavors in them. Now for the clams on a half shell well a casino chip is bigger than they are. Also we have made some low fat shrimp scampi that tasted better than this meal.   My simple requirements for a restaurant are; to cook better than me, not hard right? Really guys come on. To all that want to try this restaurant take this how you may but this is your prime example of grade B casino food. Enjoy your stay or your meal.

IHATE I ignored the reviews and gave them a try.  So I ordered the combo pan roast with lobster. It was by far the most bland thing I've ever put in my mouth. Absolutely horrid.   The review could have been saved by a little customer service. I took two bites and pushed the bowl away. Never once did a server check if everything was ok. He would walk by drop a drink refill and keep moving. Server even cleared the dishes of the people eating with me and again never addressed the elephant in the room which was this uneaten dish.   This dish was completely devoid of flavor. Complete let down as I was looking forward to dining here all week.NEVER AGAIN and I'm spreading the word on this place... Stay clear

We stayed here a few months ago and found an oyster bar downstairs. It wuz busy & crowded (that means it's good). We sat at the bar, r waitress wuz friendly. Ordered clam chowder soup ( hot & creamy), dozen raw oysters (melted in your mouth), half dozen fried oysters ( hot & delish but 2 much breading). After all that, we cudnt go 2 dinner with r friends... We'll b back in december!!!

2 thumbs down. Pan roast was a big whopping disappointment. I could get a better one at Ritter's in Huntington Beach, CA for the same price and my mouth would be dancing with joy from all the flavors. Aside from the tomato sauce, that's pretty much all the flavor you taste. It's a shame for the fresh crab and shrimp it's made with because no other flavor was present. Oyster Bar at Palace Station is still #1 in this part of town.

Great Seafood stop for lunch. Soup was awesome - cocktails come from the bar - can't go wrong with a Bloody Mary extra spicy! Good size portions - great service and the sit down seafood bar - going to try the shrimp cocktail next time around - they are huge! Will be back again to try the seafood cioppino

Big Sur is OK for oysters and seafood dishes. But we get better value and better tasting oysters at our regular spots. We came here for a pre movie dinner on a Tuesday night and sat at a table instead of the bar. There was no wait but the restaurant was full for most of our meal.  The location is at a major intersection where exiting hotel and bowling alley traffic meets with traffic moving laterally across the back of the casino. If you're sitting at a table, don't expect a quiet dinner, but one with plenty of people walking by, many smoking. So I would recommend just sitting at the bar.  The menu is one page with seafood appetizers, soup and salad, sandwiches, entrees, and a pound and a half crab leg special for $29. We started with bread and a dozen Louisiana Gold Seal oysters. The oysters were decent in size but lacking any briny or ocean flavor. About half of the oysters could have been shucked better with less shell. My wife ordered the linguine with clams in red sauce and I had the seafood diavalo with an anchor steam. My wife wasn't too happy with the sauce in her dish. My dish had a nice spicy kick with big chunks of seafood.  We had no problems with service. Take your check to the front to pay, the server doesn't cash you out. Prices were higher relative to other oyster bars. I would only come back here if we happen to be in South Point staying in the hotel or to watch a movie on $5 Tuesdays.
I've eaten here several times, every time is good.  There's a counter for fast service, great oyster shooters, & good seafood

Clam was good and hearty after eating a bowl ($8) I was full, I didn't have much space for the shrimp jambalaya we ordered. I'm glad me and my husband shared.  Overall great service, very attentive and our server Cookie was a sweetheart

My birthday is long past, it is October 4th, and a friend at work had told me he was taking me to get some king crab on my birthday, well 5 months and 19 days later we finally made it. We sat at the bar and ordered the King Crab Special in case you are not familiar with this it is 1 1/2 pounds of king crab legs with butter and lemon for 16.99. I had actually never had King Crab up to this point... The lady working the bar let us try the clam chowder which for some reason I have always just come to the predetermined decision that i did not like clam chowder, until now.. It was "AMAZING" now my grade of amazing may be different then yours when it comes to clam chowder since i had never really attempted eating it until now, so please refrain from the Clam Chowder Critic Hate Mail.. Thanks. So back to my Crab. The cook set the mound of freshly steamed crab in front of me and said enjoy, and that is exactly what I did. The meat was delicious and very plentiful. I don't think 16.99 was a bad price for the amount of crab that we got. I was very pleased with the food " a few new found favorites " and the only reason why I took a star away was really due to the casino not the restaurant. All the smoke is not very pleasant when you are eating.   After eating here I think everyone needs a little crab in there life from time to time.

I've been coming here since I was just a kid. Around 13 years old ... Before the famous pound and a half of crab legs were just 16.99 ! That was great, but they've become more popular so with high demand comes high supply! This trip I brought my boyfriend & he loved it! From his beers, to the oysters, to the scampi, to the crab legs, to the bread, & the service. Our waitress's name is Norma from Guadalajara and she is just awesome! Nice, attentive, & keeps a genuine smile on her face ! Make sure to get her as a waitress. The manager of the shift was kind enough to come by & check on how we were doing & if the food was to our liking (that's always a good sign of service & that the staff here really cares about their customers) I will continue to come here forever and always. I wish the prices were low like I remembered, but this place is totally worth every penny !

Wowsers!   So I ended up eating at this place because the cafe line was extremely long and nothing else was open. I wasn't too happy at first until I took my first bite. The New England Clam Chowder was surprisingly good and totally changed my view of the restaurant. It's actually up there with Fishemans wharf status.   In regards to other recommendations I recommend the gumbo which my wife had and couldn't get enough. My next visit to this place I'm definitely going to get something fried because everything looked so good.

Went here for the first time last night with the family when staying at the South Point Hotel Casino. Overall it was pretty good.  Pros: 1) Good, attentive, friendly service 2) Reasonably priced ($16 for 1 and 1/2 pounds of crab, $12 for fried oysters) 3) Decent food  4) SLICED CRAB! Yummy!  Cons: 1) Oyster were a little dry 2) Crab was a little dry 3) Kinda feel like this review is a little dry too.....LOL  Overall, pretty decent place to stop by if your in the neighborhood...or casino-hood.

Big Sur Oyster Bar isn't like any other quick and cheap casino eatery for gamblers looking to get some quick nutrients.  But I assure you it's nothing of the sort.   It's not cheap either, but probably one of the more affordable and convenient places to get cioppino with out braking your pockets and making reservations at since fancy shmancy Italian restaurante.  Other dishes include lobster grilled cheese, bloody mary oyster shooters and beer bartered shrimp and scallops.  Also includes the regulars (crab legs, catch of the day, etc.) As well as both Manhattan& New England style clam chowder.    The place is fast and right on the money with what I need, good food fast and close to home.    Service is mad friendly and helpful behind an open kitchen that provides that piece of mind for those skeptical about cleanliness.  Now the cioppino, it's on hit!  The tomato broth is piping hot and tasty when it comes out and includes a generous portion of scallops, shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari and lobster over linguine.  There is a tone down version that has less broth and more of a sauce, its called a Diavallo and just as good.  We usually share a portion unless you are "mob boss" hungry.  I like to pair it up with a  nice glass of Anchor Steam and keep the buns coming, ah thank you.

LOL, I love that I am considered a regular on Yelp here when I was in Vegas for a week. We stayed at our time share across the street and they gave us vouchers for the restaurants. If you couldn't tell by the fact that I am a "regular", we went there a couple times because the food was good and inexpensive. If we stay at the timeshare again, I will definitely be back to Big Sur!

We went because we got a comp. The food was decent and the portions were huge the seafood seemed fresh we had the steamed clams for an app and then i had the diablo pasta which was good, it had lots of scallops and shrimp and lobster my bf had the fried scallops and shrimp.about $80 for an app and two entrees that were kind of bland. A bit pricey and i don't think we would have gone if it was not free.

Food: $34 crab legs, fish sliders, and ceviche for lunch. My husband really likes the crab legs and has come here several times just for this. It's a better deal than paying for a buffet when this is all he wants to eat.  They get the crab from Seattle and in the winter from Canada. The fish sliders were tasty, but even better if you add salt, pepper and lemon. Ceviche was terrible - rubbery and gross. I ate two bites. I had an upset stomach a few hours later which I suspect this as the culprit.    Location: inside South Point.   Ambiance: facing the casino, so noisy.   Service: our server Alfredo was great.  Very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive.   I didn't love the ambiance of the place and I think the ceviche was bad, so I think hubby will have to get crab here with friends!

I like this oyster bar but wish it had oyster stew.  Prices are ok for high quality of food and good service.  Nice lunch specials.  Crab salad is gr8 and love the clams and linguini.  Gumbo and jumbalaya look good but too busy for me.. Good bar selection and spacious seating.  Oyster bar option available.

Seafood lacking soul  After watching a movie at the theatres, we decided to go and indulge in some seafood (party of two). This was our second time eating here and the impression Big Sur Oyster Bar made on us the second time was just like the first; lacking customer service, fast-paced, and with no personality. I understand that this may be a high volume restaurant with majority of the people wanting to get in and out, but I believe every restaurant should have a bit of passion for customer service.  I also understand that each restaurant has its own culture, but a restaurant in a major off-the-strip hotel should have a pinch or two more.   The food is decent. The Jambalya is soulless. The Combo Pan Roast lacks the flavor. It's sad when the best part of the meal is the table bread.  The customer service is sub-par with the servers at the bar gossiping about work drama and not even making eye contact to the customers. There was no suggestions for specials or meals, and our glasses of water were kept empty for the whole meal.  However, they were extremely quick to cash us out, which was probably a good thing.   Pros:  conveniently located in the Southpoint Hotel  Cons:  customer service & food  Over all 1.8 stars for poor customer service and no flavor to the food.

I give this oyster bar a 2 because the food and atmosphere is plain. We are regulars at the Oyster bar in the Santa Fe, but they close at 10pm so we tried this one since it was 11pm. It seemed like the workers were ready to go home. I was watching the chefs and every time they would get an order it was irritating for them.  Our servicer was Daniel, he was good. Always ask how we were doing.  Like I said the food was plain no spices, like we are use to. They don't offer a selection of oysters. I think the only kind they have is Louisiana oyster. It was ok. Not a true oyster bar. Their drink selections are plain too. I wouldn't drive far and pay what we did for this food.  It was OK not like we are use to with AL and the ladies and the Santa fe.

we enjoy our mealz here  ~  its quite spacious compared w other oyster bars & oysters r generally fresh  they have lunch specials under $10 M-T (noon-4pm) but i enjoy their regular menu & of course clams/oyster, etc  nobody that we brought here has not had a good experience  ~  BIG SUR deserves a solid 4-stars

I love this place. I have had the good fortune of dining here on a number of occasions and I must say that the food is fantastic and the service is equally as fantastic. All the Chefs and servers are really friendly and helpful. The clam chowder is a must have and the crab legs are great because they are already split. I've pretty much tried everything on this menu and all items are really fresh and well-prepared. I don't know why the other reviewers keep comparing this to the Palace Station because to me there is no comparison. This place has better and more flavorful food.

Took my friend here for her birthday (and some gambling). She spotted the sign for king crab legs $29.99 so in we went.  They have a large counter area for sitting, and a few tables. No wait for the counter so that's where we sat. The king crab legs were 1 1/2 lbs for $29.99, so we ordered that along with 6 oysters.  Crab legs were a bit on the small side for king crab, and not as flavorful. I've had better.  Service was very good.   Overall, not a bad place to stop in and eat. Prices a bit high as normal with a casino. I do like the South Point and hope to come back and try a few more dining options here.

After reading all the rave reviews of this place we decided to try it! Bad move! Perhaps it was a fluke but we had an uninterested waiter, awfully strong and non-mixed bloody mary oyster shooters, and two bland, overpriced entrees. I was excited to try the lobster grilled cheese, but it was incredibly bland and lobster was a little over-cooked. My boyfriend had the seared ahi caesar salad that was incredibly fishy and actually made him run to the bathroom afterwards. I wonder why...?  We got out of there as fast as possible but not without feeling incredibly frustrated with the service and the poorly made, way overpriced meal we had paid for. Will NEVER go near that place again.

My Diavolo Seafood was perfect like always! thanks to Mark (chef) and Lorena (server) for the wonderful service and dinner! I recommend this place a 100% to everyone who love seafood or to those who comes to Las Vegas and want to try a different style of dinner.

Oh South Point how I did not know you had a yummy seafood spot!    I always thought there are too many good places in vegas to eat... why eat here... welllll its goood!!! especially when they have their happy hour like sale... half off clams and oysters!! yum! so worth it!    My bf got the cioppino  and he loved it.. $30 bucks and he said its worth it.. i tried it and i thought it was cool!   be sure to use ur south point hotel packet for a free soup!  its like 5 bucks but you get it free with a purchase of entree...   their lunch specials are cheap 7.95 for a few things... the oyster sammy was good!  the best thing here tho is the half shell oyster and clams for half off... its monday-thursday 12-4 or something... starts when it opens at 12!   check it out!

It is a little pricey but I saw on the board that there are specials during the week.  The New England Clam Chowder was to die for, but it's very rich.  It's like the ice cream of soup.  Even just a cup of it with a meal was too much.  I had the Beer Battered Shrimp & Scallops with french fries and remoulade sauce. Delicious, but very rich as well.  I think the thing to do would be to get a cup of soup and then split an entree with another person and even then, you have to pace yourself.  This was my first time staying at South Point and I was pleasantly surprised at how extensive and good the dining choices are.

South Point. The destination I head to for movies, bowling, and the middle ground between my friends' homes.   I've always passed by  Big Sur and never thought of it more than an Oyster bar - which I am slightly allergic to, but I like to take a dip on the while side once in awhile - After trying a pan roast at a different location, we decided to take in some good eats.   Order the combination pan roast - good flavor but might've needed a bit more rice (could I have asked for more? I don't really know)  and the shrimp scamp - delicious sauce and the shrimps were pretty large.  Dozen oysters (for mis amigos) - they were also pretty large in size and I'm used to (and confined) to the smaller ones.   I will definitely be back to try the other concoctions that other patrons seemed to enjoy!
Awesome lunch had the oyster po boy!! awesome waitress and friendly and quick service.  thank you

This is by far my favorite oyster bar in Las Vegas . Everything is fresh and top quality . Mon-Thur from 12-4 all their appetizers are half off . The Louisiana gold seal oysters are normally $24 , so $12 a dozen is a great deal ! They also have seafood sandwiches, pan roasts, and fish n chips . Really good oyster bar !

Came here to try the pan roast since all of my friends rave about the pan roast at palace station. Unfortunately, I don't live near the palace station so had to just settle with this one. The service was okay at first, but we noticed two out of the five of our dishes were waiting to be served to our table and say under the weather for quite sometime. The pan roast didn't have that wow factor for me like everyone exclaims to have when they try it for the first time. I had to add lemon, salt, and pepper for more flavor. The fried oysters were rubbery and was probably one of the dishes sitting under the warmer.
